Barbell had no problem sending me all other correspondence especially the conversation between Sarah and i AND all the "promos" including the Elite membership so why woukd the most important correspondence be send and captured as a spam but non of the others?!?  Just resolve this simple matter i have proven that i am a repeat customer who should be valued as such or i do take my documented correspondence to 3of 7 somehow bc i am sure someone there as a fellow Christian would want fairness from a hard working supporter of them and their number one sponsor. Thank you in advance for your appreciation.

Barbell Apparel: I'm truly sorry for the frustration this has caused. I completely understand how important this matter is to you, and I wish I could resolve it directly. Unfortunately, I don't have access to our emails, so I'm unable to retrieve or review the correspondence myself. The best way forward is to reach out to our team via email, as they are fully equipped to handle these concerns and can provide a proper resolution. Thank you for your patience and for being a valued supporter-we genuinely appreciate it.

The problem is that this matter is NOT important to "you".  I am tired of the hollow "apologies" if thats what "you" call "them".  Everyone knows the old saying that If "you" want something done " you have to do it yourself. So all "you" have done is proven how much "you" value " your" customers.  Listen carefully to your commercials and it is speaking the truth.  "Your" company is not for everyone and it definitely is not what Chadd Wright thinks "you" are. If i am in the wrong then dont make excuses or lay blame just speak the truth and tell me where i went wrong in this matter.  Otherwise please tell me what to do to resolve this matter. Thank you in advance.

Barbell Apparel: I get where you're coming from because I'm a consumer, too and I'm sorry this didn't go as expected. I've sent another notification to the team and asked them if they can prioritize your concern. I will be sure to text you as soon as they provide an update.

Template used: "Are your gold plated items stamped?"; last updated: 2022-08-03 15:04:19.181

GLD: Thanks for reaching out and I'm sorry for the confusion. Our Solid Gold items are stamped with the number of karats they contain. Our Vermeil pieces start with a .925 Sterling Silver base metal and are stamped to reflect that. The rest of our items (Yellow/White/Rose Gold Plated), don't contain a stamp, only our logo. I hope this helps! Let me know if you have any further questions.

Birkenstock: Birkenstock footwear can be repaired for various types of damage or wear depending on the style. 

An authorized repair shop would be able to evaluate your footwear and give you an estimate for the necessary repairs. To locate an authorized Birkenstock Repair Shop please use our Store Locator: https://birkenstock.attn.tv/alwtu0MUGHS8 and look for the word Repair or Cobbler next to the shop name.

Modern Gents: I'm sorry for the confusion. I already checked, and your free Mini Cushion Studs in Gold were already delivered on Jan 12th. If your tracking says the package was delivered but you haven't received it, I recommend checking around your home and with nearby houses, just in case it was dropped off by mistake. Also, check with anyone you live with, like family, roommates, or a landlord, to see if they accepted it for you. Sometimes packages are also held by property managers, an apartment office, or even your local post office. Let me know if you can't find it, I'm here to help!

Template used: "How do I view and claim my rewards? "; last updated: 2025-12-01 17:50:28.598

Julie Vos: Thank you for your purchase! That's a good question. Yes! You earn points with every purchase from JulieVos.com. You may redeem your points for a future order using the instructions below.

1. Visit our Rewards Page:
Visit https://julievos.attn.tv/aHvwLr6cV_tt
2. Log In or Join:
Once you're on the Rewards page, click the Get Started button, then select Login.
If you already have a Julie Vos account, please log in. If not, click Create account to set up a new account.
3. Scroll to "Redeem Rewards":
Once you're signed in, scroll down the page until you see the Redeem Rewards section. This is where you'll see how many points you have and how much they're worth.
Here's a screenshot to help you spot it easily: https://julievos.attn.tv/ajegdjxGHCcO

(This image should show the Redeem Rewards section with the slider and redeem button visible.)

4. Choose How Many Points to Use:
Use the slider to pick how many points you'd like to redeem. You'll see how much money you'll save based on your selection.
5. Click "Redeem":
After choosing your points, click the Redeem button. This will generate a unique discount code just for you.
6. Use the Code at Checkout:
At checkout, paste your code into the box that says "Discount code or gift card", then click Apply.
Helpful Tip:
If you ever lose track of your code, no worries! Just go back to the Redeemed tab in the Redeem Rewards section to view it again.
Points expire 12 months after they are earned, but don't worry - we'll send you a reminder ahead of time so you'll have the chance to use them before they expire.

If you run into any trouble at all, don't hesitate to reach back out, we're always happy to help!

I need to order 19 fat heads for high school senior ski team. How long would that take to have done?
Hello

Cardboard Cutout Standees: Sorry for the slow reply! We usually ship via UPS, and orders placed by 10 am on a business day will leave our facility the following business day. We have multiple shipping options available at checkout that can deliver orders in as quickly as 1 business day. Check them out here: https://cardboard.attn.tv/aIBZ5Mj2O5iT
Thank you! Helpful!

One more question. 
What group rates/cost 
would it be for 19 fat heads?
Thanks
Cardboard Cutout Standees: You're welcome! I can definitely check on this for you. Can you let me know the size you're looking to get? Can I also have your e-mail address?

Bethbert@yahoo.com.

Also, you may have on file the fatheads that were ordered last year for Lincoln Sudbury regional high school ski team. Whatever those sizes are is what we will take this year? 
I'm new at this but I will dig and see if o can find out size

Cardboard Cutout Standees: Thank you. Do you happen to have the order number or the email address used to place last year's order so we can check? For Big Heads, the available sizes are 12, 24, 26, and 47 inches. Let me know!

Hi,
So I got in touch with the person in charge of the fatheads last year and we ordered 24-26.
I copied and pasted her note below.
Seems like two other important things we would need is same size heads do the girls and boys. 
Also- a clear image of the faces so high quality prints.

Hi, yes that is the size I ordered. However, the boys' fat heads were a lot larger than the girls because they included the long hair on the girls within that size. If you want all faces the same size (which I would recommend because the size difference was significant) there is an option to trim long hair out of the fat head. It's up to you but just wanted to make note of that. Definitely make sure you are getting a print quality digital image for each senior so that they come out clearly. Hope this helps!

scenarios.customerMessage: I still need assistance with my account

important:
# üì¨ SEND TO CS

‚Ä¢ Send to CS immediately for post-purchase issues

‚Ä¢ Send to CS for payment processing issues
# üì¢ TONE

‚Ä¢ Don't use the term restock

‚Ä¢ Don't tell customers that we'll be restocking

‚Ä¢ Don't respond to blank messages

‚Ä¢ Don't use formal language

‚Ä¢ Close the conversation when a customer responds 'no'
# ‚ö° TEMPLATES

‚Ä¢ If a cx reaches out regarding the Early Access event, use EAE shortcut

‚Ä¢ For cx reaching out in Spanish use SSC shortcut

‚Ä¢ For checkout issues use the "Check out Issues" temp

‚Ä¢ For store item availability, use SPA shortcut

‚Ä¢ If cx's email doesn't work for early access, use EEA shortcut
# ‚úÖ DOs AND DON'Ts

‚Ä¢ They occasionally run sign-up campaigns where cx text certain keywords (‚Äúreleases,‚Äù ‚Äúearly access‚Äù) to join a list. If a customer sends a similar keyword:

‚ûú Check the website banner or landing page to confirm if it's a current keyword trigger
‚ûú If confirmed, close the convo, if not you can respond

‚Ä¢ All clothing is true to size unless otherwise stated on the product page

‚Ä¢ You can use these sizing charts for reference (for internal use only): https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1kmra_vOwCJuHoAx9D4L4Qx95rxafHcrqn-ZGutfzLgg/edit?usp=sharing

üÖøÔ∏è If customers say they want to purchase in store - encourage them to buy online & pick up in-store

‚Ä¢ For store info q's (phone number/additional info) - use the store locator with your VPN turned on!
# üõí DRIVE TO PURCHASE

üÖøÔ∏è If customers are looking for an outfit recommendation/item pairing - direct them to the "shop the look" section on each product page or use the LK shortcut

# üì¨ SEND TO CS

# üõë ESCALATE

‚Ä¢ ESC immediately if the customer wants an order to arrive at a specific time, or before our standard shipping time

‚Ä¢ ESC for product info that you can't find on the site
# üì¢ TONE

‚Ä¢ Close the convo once the client takes over
# ‚ö° TEMPLATES

‚Ä¢ If cx sends us their measurements or asks about making a custom sizing order use the CUS template.

‚Ä¢ If cx mentions that they're going to lose weight, use 'Lose weight' template.
# ‚úÖ DOs AND DON'Ts

‚Ä¢ Do not recommend the customer go to a place to get measured

‚Ä¢ "@ The Vault" items are designated for returns/exchanges, but may also be available in other sizes on The Vault website. Always check there first

‚Ä¢ When the color is closer to white and not cream we say off white

‚Ä¢ You should never direct the customer to the sizing chart when they mention custom sizing or they send their measurements

‚Ä¢ Don't tell the customer to hold off on purchase if they are going to lose weight.
# üõí DRIVE TO PURCHASE

‚Ä¢ When recommending products, make sure they're aligned with the colors, style the cx is looking for
# ‚ú® PROMO & PROMO EXCLUSIONS

‚Ä¢ If cx ask about pricing, tell them to add items to their cart and the best discount will apply automatically

‚Ä¢ The 40% discount applies automatically when cx add five or more items to their cart

FragranceNet: I apologize for the confusion this has caused. "Label Created" means that a shipping label has been generated by us, but the package has not yet been scanned or picked up by the carrier. The package might still be waiting for pickup or may have already been dropped off but not yet scanned. Please give it a few more days.
